feed.title: Radio System Design
feed.subtitle: Radio System Design is an RF and Microwave consultancy with over 40 years of experience

entry.title: Web SDR
entry.content:
Getting Started with SDR

If you are just interested in SDR then you can find out more from our free guide.

Or to learn more download the guide and a Ubuntu live distribution with all the software and files used in the presentation from this free software link. (See also paragraph below)

You donâ€™t even need a radio or any software because, enthusiasts around the world have generously installed SDRs and made them available on the web. All you need is an internet connection, a web browser and some help to get started.

The guide is a presentation to show you the basics. Essentially your web connection allows you to listen in and control an SRD remotely and the guide show you:

  • Examples of web SDRs and where you can find others
  • How to control kiwiSDR, which is one of the most common
  • How to record IQ data for further processing
  • Examples of processing recorded signals using GNU Radio
  • Some of the dedicated decoders available via web SDRs
